pr_title: [WFCORE-4874] Turn pre-computed annotation index loading error into a…

timeline.author: jmesnil

replies.bodyText: The e.toString() is more complete. We could have the exception without any message text. The  e.toString()` shows the exception message, if it exists, plus the exception class name.
replies.author: yersan

timeline.bodyText: thanks for the explanation. In that case, this string should be more generic like Loading failed for the annotation index \"%s\" with the following exception: %s
timeline.author: jmesnil
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -140,9 +140,9 @@
      * Message for when a pre-computed annotation index cannot be loaded
      * @param index name of the annotation index
      */
-    @LogMessage(level = ERROR)
-    @Message(id = 2, value = "Could not read provided index: %s")
-    void cannotLoadAnnotationIndex(String index);
+    @LogMessage(level = WARN)
+    @Message(id = 2, value = "Loading failed for the annotation index \"%s\" with the following failure message: %s")

timeline.message: [WFCORE-4874] Turn pre-computed annotation index loading error into a warning and print related description
[WFCORE-4874] Turn pre-computed annotation index loading error into a warning and print related description
